structure.unit: PHYSICIANS, OSTEOPATHS, PODIATRISTS, AND RELATED MEDICAL PRACTITIONERS

law.text: Amygdalin (laetrile) shall only be available to a patient by prescription from his doctor and only after the patient affirms his desire for treatment using this substance by signing a written informed request form and the physician has determined the patient to be terminally ill.
law.history: Created 1980 Ky. Acts ch. 354, sec. 2, effective July 15, 1980.
